headline.main: Mrs. Morrow Asks Fair Hearing For Honest Isolationists' Views; Respect for Their Sincerity Urged on Women at Launching of Fight-for-Freedom Drive. -- But She Calls for War if Necessary

lead_paragraph: Mrs. Dwight W. Morrow, mother of Mrs. Charles A. Lindbergh and Widow of the former United States Ambassador to Mexico, speaking yesterday afternoon at the Roosevelt Hotel at a meeting of 400 New York women launching the new national's women's organization of the Fight for Freedom Committee, declared that the views of persons who oppose aid to Great Britain Should be respected, even if not accepted.
abstract: Attends Fight for Freedom Com meeting, illus
